article.heading: Clinical significance
article.paragraph: Image:Penicillin core.svgthumb180pxPenicillin core structureThe -lactam ring is part of the core structure of severalantibioticfamilies, the principal ones being thepenicillins,cephalosporins,carbapenems, andmonobactams, which are, therefore, also called-lactam antibiotics. Nearly all of these antibiotics work by inhibiting bacterialcell wallbiosynthesis. This has a lethal effect onbacteria. Bacteria do, however, contain within their populations, in smaller quantities, bacteria that areantibiotic resistanceresistantagainst -lactam antibiotics. They do this by expressing one of manybeta-lactamase-lactamasegenes. More than 1,000 different -lactamase enzymes have been documented in various species of bacteria.cite journalEhmannDavid E.2012Avibactam is a covalent, reversible, non-β-lactam β-lactamase inhibitorPNAS1092911663–1166810.1073/pnas.1205073109etalThese enzymes vary widely in their chemical structure and catalytic efficiencies.When bacterial populations have these resistant subgroups, treatment with -lactam can result in the resistant strain becoming more prevalent and therefore more virulent.

article.heading: Other applications
article.paragraph: A new study has suggested that -lactams can undergo ring-openingpolymerizationto form amide bonds, to become nylon-3 polymers. The backbones of these polymers are identical to peptides, which offer them biofunctionality. These nylon-3 polymers can either mimichost defense peptidesor act as signals to stimulate3T3stem cellfunction.Citation neededNovember 2011
